title: Array Repeat operator should not use a loop for small sizes

labels.name: A-LLVM
labels.description: Area: Code generation parts specific to LLVM. Both correctness bugs and optimization-related issues.

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
This likely caused poor assembly for `Simd::splat` in some circumstances:
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/257879-project-portable-simd/topic/Very.20bad.20.60u16x8.3A.3Asplat.60.20codegen.20on.20x86_64

I opened a PR for a workaround: https://github.com/rust-lang/portable-simd/pull/284

Reduced reproducer:
https://godbolt.org/z/rhvEjz5MW
```rust
#![feature(portable_simd)]
use core::{mem, simd::u8x16};

pub fn f(v: u16, p: &mut [u8; 16]) {
    unsafe {
        let v: u8x16 = mem::transmute([v; 8]);
        *p = mem::transmute(v);
    }
}
```
